conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The image shows liquid flowing from A, B, C, and D through the baffles.
The baffles are designed to guide the flow of the liquid in a specific direction.
Baffle A is directed towards container E.
Baffle B is directed towards container E.
Baffle C is directed towards container F.
Baffle D is directed towards container F.

premise: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E because the baffles are directed towards E.
conclusion: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E.

premise: Liquid from C and D will flow into container F because the baffles are directed towards F.
conclusion: Liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
In the second image, we can see that the blue and cyan liquids (from A and B) are flowing into container E.
In the third image, we can see that the orange and purple liquids (from C and D) are flowing into container F.

premise: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E. Liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
conclusion: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E. Liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
